_header: Bliss it were in land to haven worship and might
_description: Worldly Honour is Brief — two couplets (long lines)

BLHar2316.Transcription: Blisse it were in londe to hauen wrschipe and mihtyef ded miht no man reuen his rihtBut blisse lestit no thing and ȝat is mikel schameAnd ded is at ȝyn ending and doet awey ȝi name
BLHar2316.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 2.121.
